title: Here's a reading list of 20 articles up to 2021 that cover various aspects of performing speech-to-text translation in an end-to-end fashion
note: as well as other related speech-to-text tasks:

title: Attend and Spell"** by William Chan, Navdeep Jaitly, Quoc Le, Oriol Vinyals
This paper introduces an end-to-end speech recognition model using attention mechanisms
**"Deep Speech: Scaling up end-to-end speech recognition"** by Dario Amodei et al
This work presents the Deep Speech 2 system, which scales up end-to-end speech recognition models
**"Sequence to Sequence Learning with Neural Networks"** by Ilya Sutskever, Oriol Vinyals, Quoc V
Although not specific to speech-to-text, this foundational paper introduces the sequence-to-sequence framework used in many speech-to-text models
**"Attention-Based Models for Speech Recognition"** by Jan Chorowski
This paper explores attention mechanisms in the context of speech recognition
**"End-to-End Speech Recognition with Connectionist Temporal Classification"** by Alex Graves
Introduces the CTC loss function, which is crucial for many end-to-end speech recognition systems
**"WaveNet: A Generative Model for Raw Audio"** by Aaron van den Oord et al
While primarily focused on audio generation, WaveNet's architecture has influenced many speech-to-text models
**"Joint CTC-Attention Models for Speech Recognition"** by Takaaki Hori, Shinji Watanabe
This paper combines CTC and attention mechanisms for improved end-to-end speech recognition
**"Speech Recognition with Deep Recurrent Neural Networks"** by Alex Graves
Discusses the use of deep RNNs for speech recognition tasks
**"Deep Speech 2: End-to-End Speech Recognition in English and Mandarin"** by Dario Amodei et al
Extends the Deep Speech model to multiple languages and introduces several improvements
**"End-to-End Speech Translation with the Transformer"** by Ye Jia et al
Applies the Transformer architecture to the task of end-to-end speech translation
**"SpecAugment: A Simple Data Augmentation Method for Automatic Speech Recognition"** by Daniel S
Introduces a data augmentation technique that has become standard in training robust speech recognition models
**"ESPnet: End-to-End Speech Processing Toolkit"** by Shinji Watanabe et al
Describes an open-source toolkit for end-to-end speech processing, including speech recognition and translation
**"Transformer Transducer: A Streamable Speech Recognition Model with Transformer Encoders and RNN-T Loss"** by Anmol Gulati et al
Combines Transformer encoders with the RNN-T loss for streamable speech recognition
**"Improving End-to-End Speech Recognition with Policy Learning"** by Anirudh Raju et al
Explores the use of reinforcement learning to improve end-to-end speech recognition models
**"End-to-End Speech Recognition and Translation with the Transformer"** by Matthias Sperber et al
Investigates the use of the Transformer model for both speech recognition and translation

author.literal: **"End-to-End Speech Translation"** by Matthias Sperber, Jan Niehues, Graham Neubig, Alex Waibel

title: A comprehensive survey on end-to-end speech translation
**"Self-Supervised Learning for Speech Recognition: A Survey"** by Yatharth Saraf et al
Reviews self-supervised learning techniques for speech recognition, which are crucial for reducing dependency on labeled data
Unsupervised Pre-training for Speech Recognition"** by Alexei Baevski
Introduces an unsupervised pre-training method for speech recognition
**"Wav2vec 2.0: A Framework for Self-Supervised Learning of Speech Representations"** by Alexei Baevski
note: Yuhao Zhou, Abdelrahman Mohamed, Michael Auli (2020

title: Extends the Wav2vec framework to improve performance on speech recognition tasks
**"Conformer: Convolution-augmented Transformer for Speech Recognition"** by Anmol Gulati et al
Combines convolutional neural networks with Transformers to create a powerful model for speech recognition
These articles provide a comprehensive overview of the advancements in end-to-end speech-to-text translation and related tasks up to
